content.question: A block is placed on a horizontal surface and attached to one end of a spring. The other end of the spring is attached to a fixed wall. The block oscillates such that its <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></math>-position is described by the graph shown. Starting at time <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, an external force <math alttext="F equals F sub 0 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, 2 pi t, close parenthesis, i hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></math>, where <math alttext="F sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is a positive constant, is applied to the block. Which of the following best describes how the block’s motion changes, if at all, when the external force is being applied?

choices.label: The period of the motion increases, and the amplitude of the motion remains the same.
The period of the motion remains the same, and the amplitude of the motion increases.
Both the period and the amplitude of the motion increase.
Both the period and the amplitude of the motion remain the same.

content.answer: The period of the motion remains the same, and the amplitude of the motion increases.
